name: St. Regis Hotel

reviews.text: This is my second trip to Vancouver and would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
" W " meets " Hampton Inn"
reviews.text: When we arrived we were upgraded to a Junior suite and we were meet with very attentive staff. Our room presented extremely well with beautiful amenties and very comfortable beds and fluffly towels, very important when travelling.
The breakfast was table service with a large choice to satisfy everyone.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel!

reviews.text: The staff in the bar especially Chelsea and on the front desk Brittany cant thank enough for their kindness and help in directing us to many attractions.
reviews.title: going the extra mile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I look forward to another stay next year when back in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Exceptionally comfortable stay in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the St. Regis and had no problem with the street noise except on Saturday night but it's bearable. A nicely refurbished hotel although the standard rooms ae not big but okay for two persons. An upgrade comes with a seperate sitting area and the bedrooms are more or less the same size. Bathroom is very nice. All the staff we met are so friendly and welcoming. Breakfast is good althought the breakfast room is dated comparing to the rest of the hotel. Something brighter and more cheerful will help to start the morning off nicely. We think it's a good experience and good value especially with the winter rate. The location is perfect with sky train and other amenities all within short walking distance.
reviews.title: Exceeds expectation.

reviews.text: We Loved the St Regis Hotel! We stayed for 4 nights we were greeted on arrival by staff and they immediently helped us with our bags for a quick efficient check in. We were given the option to upgrade our room if we wished, I didn't catch his name but one of the staff showed us what the upgraded room was like an when looking at it we immediently said yes! The room was beautiful, a bedroom with a king bed and a flat screen tv. The lounge room also had a flat screen tv and bathroom. very clean and very comfortable they also have a "media hub" in each room which allows you to watch your own movies or view photos on the tv which we found excellent. The other fantastic thing about this hotel is definetly the breakfast it's free and it's made to order which we loved! The hotel is centrally located in downtown Vancouver and we had no difficulty getting around. Staff always friendly we had an issue where the vanity mirror broke, the next morning while we were out it's was fully replaced! Very efficient service. We also tried room service which we enjoyed too. Would definetly stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited vancouver in mid-december and stayed at st. regis. We booked their $99/night promotion for 3 nights. The location was ideal just a few blocks away from granville st and the waterfront. The service was attentive and polite from check in to check out. This hotel is located in a historic building. We could not locate the parking when we arrived since the approach is from an alley behind the hotel, very easy to miss. The rooms are small but are clean and have a boutique like feel. The tiny elevator can be a problem but we chose to use the stairway for the most part except when we had luggage. The breakfast was by far one of the best I've had while staying at hotels, worth every reason getting up for in the morning. Really great value for those looking to stay in the heart of Vancouver and who want to be in the middle of the action.
reviews.title: great value for money in the heart of vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Great service, all departments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Heated floors in the bathroom
reviews.title: Excellent room, location, and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a 2 night stopover late March 2011. Easy and cheap access from airport on Skytrain, a 5 minute walk from Vancouver City station.
reviews.title: Great service, rooms lacking.

reviews.text: Hotel is well located for shops and harbour front, and a 30 minute brisk walk to Stanley Park. A day pass on the excellent public transport is great value for money for exploring Vancouver and North Vancouver on the Seabus.
reviews.title: St. Regis is a keeper

reviews.text: Service was impeccable and cooked breakfast was superb, although Continental option was lacking inspiration. The bar/restaurant attached was fine for a 'pub' meal, anything more elaborate is not so easy to find Downtown.
reviews.title: Great hosts...

reviews.text: The room was disappointing. Although well furnished with a very comfortable bed it was a little on the small size. The adjacent room was a suite and it seemed that the floor space had been compromised to accomodate it. Incredibly for a hotel of this standard it had no room minibar or fridge. Even the staff were surprised when we had to ask them to use their staff fridge overnight.
reviews.title: Cozy Boutique Hotel in Great Location!

reviews.text: There is free wifi and internet lounge, and free international telephone calls from the room. We tried to make a call on four occasions and either the line didn't connect or the person being called could not hear us, so the value of this feature was lost on us.
reviews.title: Happy patrons

reviews.text: I had a wonderful, awesome stay in this Hotel.
reviews.title: What a wonderful stay!

reviews.text: All of staff are so kind, so nice! By the grace of them, I was able to have pleasant time in Vancouver. Thank you so much!
reviews.title: We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were incredibly happy with this hotel. Very clean and updated, very polite and helpful service, and in a Great, very walkable location. Booking through the hotel itself provided a great rate, and the free Wi-Fi and breakfast are a wonderful benefit. Although the Smart Queen was a bit small, it was fine for the price and all the other amenities of this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent room and service

reviews.text: Great boutique hotel. The staff are friendly and enthusiastic! They were eager to suggest activities and help us find a rental car. We will definitely stay here again. The room was clean updated. This is an environmentally conscious hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!"

reviews.text: The staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms/bathrooms were very clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast lounge and waitstaff were perfect. Lots of little extras at this hotel (free printing in the bussiness center, long distance calls) made a big difference!
reviews.title: Great location for seeing Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The St. Regis was great and right downtown. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. After I left and forgot something there they were quick and returned it to my home right away. The hotel looked nice with artwork everywhere. The room had a super deep bathtub, was stylish and quite deluxe. It was a great stay and I would certainly go back anytime!
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I need very dark and quiet to sleep. It was perfect and the mattress was heavenly.
reviews.title: HEAVENLY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was more than expected - the location was great - downtown - and I would stay again anytime.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: What a great hotel. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, it was just a pleasure for us as new to the city to be assisted as we were.
reviews.title: My new favourite Vancouver hotel!!

reviews.text: The hotel room was well appointed and great value when we were there in March. Our room was very quiet at night and very comfortable. The hotel is well located if you want to stay in downtown Vancouver.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel, wonderful service/amenities, good price for location

reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights on a long weekend away. We used points to stay these. I chose the hotel because of the good deal and because I thought it was connected to the St. Regis chain. Despite that, the hotel is a quality boutique hotel. There is a nice breakfast provided. The hotel is centrally located.
reviews.title: Good stuff. Not a Starwood resort.

reviews.text: The critiques I have are
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE, BEAUTIFUL ROOM...QUALITY EVERYWHERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the size of the rooms - small;
reviews.title: Great location and value right in the heart of downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Windows are poorly insulated;
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service

reviews.text: Bathroom is not well heated - but has a cold window;
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd time here.
reviews.title: Great 2nd stay at the St. Regis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jeremy (the General Manager) personally checked us in an hour before check-in and took our bags up. There is also Juan at the front desk who was very knowledgeable, articulate and patient.
reviews.title: Clean, modern, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the top floor (5th) facing the street.
reviews.title: Superior Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities are quite in line with any other world class boutique hotel. Excellent size room, heated floors in the bathroom, complimentary Fiji bottled water, mints on turndown service.
reviews.title: Book it now!

reviews.text: Road noise is apparent due to the location of the property but that disadvantage turns rosy during the daytime as there is a Tim Hortons (open till 2am) and an A&W restaurant (open 24hrs) right across the street. High end shopping like Holt Renfrew is available to your wallet a block away.
reviews.title: Chic, luxurious boutique hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the St Regis for one night in a queen corner room. The hotel has worked hard to separate itself from the other large major players downtown and it shows. Excellent boutique experience and lots of "value add" that make the guest feel special and unique. With only 65 rooms, its personal and has a real European feel (translate to the elevator is tiny but efficient!). Besides being clean and well appointed, loved the extras including an awesome makeup mirror in the bathroom, heated bathroom floor, fitness pass, free wireless (are you reading that big box hotels!!) and free long distance calling!! Staff were really really well trained and it showed. Well done St Regis!
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel experience

reviews.text: I just returned from a 4 night stay with my young son. The hotel is an easy 1 block from the Skytrain and in a busy (filled with students) neighborhood with lots of restaurants and shops. The staff is absolutely wonderful: attentive, knowledgeable, and organized. We were very comfortable in our room and loved the breakfast but the staff made the St. Regis unique in our minds. We would love to stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, lovely room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at St Regis for 2 nights in early May of 2011. Room is clean and the washroom is spotless with heated floor, we were impressed! Love the Fiji bottle of water. The location is excellent that we walked to most places (Gastown, Chinatown, Granville street..etc.) Took the bus to the Granville island market (do not miss this, lots of good eats). Lots small restaurants and shops around the hotel, there is a coffee shop and also a drugmart across the street from the hotel. We had a excellent stay, the staff is most helpful and the hot breakfast is very satifying. Wouldn't think off stay anywhere else when we visit Vancouver.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Right near Gastown, downtown shopping, skytrain. Staff was awesome, room was comfortable and not noisy on the fifth floor. Great breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice weekend getaway!

reviews.text: I stayed at the SR twice, flying out of and back into YVR on business. The proximity of the SR to the southbound Skytrain to YVR was a big consideration and that worked out beautifully. It's a 3 minute walk, mostly covered, to the Downtown Skytrain terminal and a tidy 25 minutes or so to YVR for less that 5 bucks.
reviews.title: Entirely civilized, close to YVR Skytrain.

description: THE ST. REGIS HOTEL – DOWNTOWN VANCOUVER CANADA. Perfectly located in the centre of downtown Vancouver, the St. Regis Hotel is the city’s best choice for award-winning service and refined boutique hotel accommodations. The independent, Canadian-owned and operated St. Regis recently completed a total renovation that brought this beautiful heritage building up to the highest level of modern comfort and finish. The St. Regis all-inclusive room rates include complimentary FULL BREAKFAST, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET, FREE LOCAL AND WORLDWIDE LONG DISTANCE, FIJI BOTTLED WATER, STEVE NASH SPORTS CLUB PASSES, AND BUSINESS CENTRE ACCESS. Winner of the 2010, 2011, and 2012 TripAdvisor's Travellers Choice Awards for Service for Vancouver hotels, with one stay you will see why the St. Regis Hotel is "more than you expect, everything you deserve."
